image.altText: A man in a suit with grey hair leans back and gestures as he speaks on a stage.

props.synopsis: Nine Entertainment's board confirms the resignation in a statement, saying Mr Costello will "step down from the board effective immediately".Â

title.children: Nine board chairman Peter Costello resigns after reportedly assaulting a journalist

image.altText: Gumbaynggirr and Yamatji singer Emma Donovan

props.synopsis: Award-winning Indigenous musician Emma Donovan will lodge a complaint with the taxi industry regulator after she says two cabs at Perth Airport refused to give her a ride "because of the colour of [her] skin".

title.children: 'They don't take my kind': Indigenous musician to lodge complaint after being refused taxi service

image.altText: Two men in wetsuits stand together near water

props.synopsis: Loved ones pay tribute to Australian brothers Callum and Jake Robinson, who were killed alongside their American friend Carter Rhoad during a surfing trip in Mexico.

title.children: Brothers Callum and Jake Robinson farewelled at emotional memorial service

image.altText: A man and woman stand together outside a house, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: An ABC investigation uncovers sensational allegations by a whistleblower that dozens of expectant mothers who attended a Queensland hospital received substandard maternity care that put their babies' lives at risk and did not follow official clinical guidelines.

title.children: Lacey and Severio lost their baby at a Queensland hospital. One question haunts them

image.altText: A man is smiling while being hugged by his mother, who is also smiling.

props.synopsis: The IDF says the hostages were rescued from the al-Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza, where Palestinian authorities say at least 210 Palestinians have been killed and 400 wounded in an Israeli bombardment.

title.children: Four Israeli hostages rescued in IDF operation that left scores dead in central Gaza

image.altText: Michael Mosley speaks and gestures with his hands

props.synopsis: The 67-year-old was holidaying with his wife on the Greek island of Symi when he went for a coastal walk on Wednesday afternoon, but never returned.Â

title.children: Greek authorities confirm they have found the body of Michael Mosley

image.altText: A teenage girl with blonde hair holds a mobile phone with both hands, with the phone in focus and her face obscured.

props.synopsis: The Coalition hopes the federal government will agree to put aside politics to cut kids off from social media, as it continues to push for a ban.

title.children: 'Nobody says, let's show an R-rated movie to a 10-year-old': Coalition's push to stop social media for under 16-year-olds

image.altText: Women's hands holding a gift basket full of goodies.

props.synopsis: Inside a discreet character home, women are making gift boxes in secrecy. It's their only chance to work and not be found by violent ex-partners.

title.children: Secret gift box business helps women escape violence

image.altText: A teenage girl stands in front of a small plane in a hangar.

props.synopsis: Farmers and young people have flocked to the school amid a national decline in aviation training centres.

title.children: Flight school opens in remote part of WA, bucking national trend

image.altText: Two people wave in a front yard next to a leaning tower.

props.synopsis: In the biggest city on WA's southern coast, a scale replica of the Italian icon has brought joy to generations of locals and visitors.

title.children: This country town's replica Leaning Tower has brought joy to generations

image.altText: Zac Williams kisses his wrist as he pays tribute to his late sister.

props.synopsis: Carlton's Zac Williams dedicates a goal to his late sister Sammy, as the Blues score a 26-point win over the Bombers at the MCG. Follow live.

title.children: Zac Williams pays emotional tribute to late sister as Blues get past Bombers

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FT: Blues beat Bombers to take second spot
3QT: Blues lead but Bombers staying in the hunt
HT: Blues hold comfortable 32-point lead over Bombers

image.altText: People holding Palestinian flags march during a rally in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A spokesperson for Foreign Minister Penny Wong has reiterated Australia's call for a ceasefire as hundreds of Australians attend pro-Israel and pro-Palestine rallies across the country.

title.children: Wong repeats calls for 'all hostages released' and 'civilians protected' following rescue in central Gaza

image.altText: NRL player Xavier Coates grounds the ball for a try, while the rest of his body is airborne

props.synopsis: Melbourne has held on for a 36-28 victory over the Newcastle Knights as winger Xavier Coates produced another brilliant try to his highlight reel.

title.children: Xavier Coates defies gravity again to score another try-of-the-year contender

image.altText: Friends with Dev Deka and parents at birthday celebration.

props.synopsis: Friends and family help Devarshi Deka celebrate his birthday â but say the greatest gift he could receive is to be allowed to remain in Australia after being left with disabilities following an alleged assault in Hobart.

title.children: Indian student left with disabilities after alleged assault turns 33 as fight to stay in Australia goes on

image.altText: Princess Kate smiles to the side in a red blazer

props.synopsis: The royal will miss the Trooping the Colour rehearsal, which is a 260-year-old tradition in which troops in full dress uniform parade past the king with their ceremonial flag.

title.children: Princess Kate apologises for missing rehearsal before King Charles's birthday

image.altText: A large black stencil of Beethoven's head on a white wall in Verona, Italy.

props.synopsis: Beethoven's 'Ode To Joy' has topped the Classic 100: Feel Good poll, but music for the screen stole the show with 25 pieces for the screen making the top 100.

title.children: Bluey to Beethoven: Australia's feel-good classical soundtrack is an eclectic ray of sunshine

image.altText: Andrey Kozlov walking out of Israeli helicopter after rescue.

props.synopsis: Israel has carried out its largest hostage rescue operation, taking four to safety out of central Gaza in a heavy air and ground assault that Gazan health officials say has killed scores of Palestinians. Here's what we know about how the daytime mission unfolded.

title.children: How Israel's hostage rescue and deadly assault in central Gaza unfolded

image.altText: A young baby wrapped in a blanket with medical monitoring equipment attached to various parts of its body.

props.synopsis: The saga started in 2017, and this week, a court challenge revealed new details about three newborns left within kilometres of each other in east London. The "extremely rare" occurrence has put the spotlight on child abandonment â a phenomenon some say is poorly understood.

title.children: Three babies were abandoned in London over seven years. A DNA test revealed a devastating truth

image.altText: a composite image of a love heart illuminated over sydney harbour and a crowd crush at circular quay

props.synopsis: Large crowds are again expected to line Sydney Harbour for Vivid Festival's second drone show, as people are urged to be patient and organisers say they are experienced in crowd control. Â

title.children: More safety measures, extra police at second Sydney drone show after attendees speak of crush fears

image.altText: Daniel Ricciardo

props.synopsis: Daniel Ricciardo takes aim at former F1 champion Jacques Villeneuve after the Australian qualified fifth fastest for the Canadian Grand Prix.

title.children: 'He's hit his head a few too many times': Ricciardo hits back at F1 champ after blistering qualifying

image.altText: Travis Head plays a shot

props.synopsis: A brilliant powerplay sets the tone as Australia completes a comfortable victory over arch-rivals England at the T20 World Cup.

title.children: Australia demolishes England in T20 World Cup clash after stunning opening partnership

image.altText: A container shed sits in the forground of the photo with a sign, 'Maleny Golf Club' as the Milky Way shines overhead.

props.synopsis: Renowned for its multi-million-dollar wedding industry, Queensland's Sunshine Coast hinterland hopes to add stargazing to its tourism drawcard.

title.children: Sunshine Coast hinterland's bid to attract stargazers by becoming Dark Sky Reserve

image.altText: Portrait of a woman with her white, small, vintage car.

props.synopsis: Meg Grealy says her car attracts attention every time she takes it out for the day and has opened the door to a new world.

title.children: Meg can only drive Mighty Boy for 60 days a year, but it's a head-turner wherever she goes

image.altText: A young white boy doing a backflip on a trampoline

props.synopsis: Experts say emerging research shows a link between risky play and less psychological distress in adolescent years. Could this be part of the solution to the current teen mental health crisis?Â

title.children: A century ago, a Danish architect noticed kids avoiding his parks. His solution? The risky playground

image.altText: Caroline laying in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: Nearly 16 years ago, Caroline Southcott got up to go to the toilet on a flight from Singapore to Perth. As she was returning to her seat, she suffered severe injuries that continue to impact her to this day.

title.children: Caroline was a seasoned flyer who wore her seatbelt on long-haul flights. Then she got up to go to the bathroom

image.altText: A man wearing a blue cap, polo shirt, cargo shorts and sunglasses opens his backpack on a beach

props.synopsis: Clare Bailey Mosley says her family won't lose hope as the search for Michael Mosley continues for a third day.

title.children: Michael Mosley's wife says the days have been 'unbearable' since TV doctor went missing

image.altText: A family posed with a dog on the bonnet of an old rusty truck.

props.synopsis: Facing closure, Kay Tommerup saved her family's dairy farm by cutting ties with processors and embracing agritourism. Now she wants to change the future for other small farmers.

title.children: With no more middlemen, these family farms have saved themselves with agritourism

image.altText: A mattress and other rubbish has been dumped on this land in Truganina

props.synopsis: With Facebook Marketplace and Airtasker offering easy solutions to waste management, authorities are urging due diligence to ensure rubbish is being disposed of the right way.

title.children: $20 to take an old mattress to the tip sounds like a steal ... but where is the rubbish ending up?

image.altText: A woman in a grocery isle of fruit and vegetables

props.synopsis: There's a growing divide in the prices of goods, and it's making the Reserve Bank's job harder. But the federal budget's cost-of-living measures may buy the RBA more time.

title.children: There's a 'great divide' in Australia's economy, and it's complicating the inflation challenge

image.altText: Two people gaze at paintings in an art gallery.

props.synopsis: Frank Harding built a studio and art gallery for himself in the 1970s and filled it with magnificent works. It has been untouched since his death and his daughter would like more people to come and appreciate its treasures.

title.children: 'Diehard Australian' collection of a detective-turned-professional artist

image.altText: A young girl in a white peasant top is held by two police officers

props.synopsis: The trial of a 20-year-old American in Italy had all the elements of a salacious tabloid story, but at the core of the case lay a bungled investigation and an overeager prosecution â and some uncomfortable truths about how society treats young women.

title.children: Amanda Knox fought an eight-year battle to clear her name. Yet some still believe she is guilty

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Welcome back for another week of embarrassment! Oops, I meant humiliation.

title.children: Could you beat a Hard Quiz contestant? Prove it. It's time to play, HARD!

image.altText: A woman smiling while she holds a baby at the beach

props.synopsis: From having babies on their own to choosing to be single, these Australians believe life isn't necessarily easier â or better â with a partner.

title.children: Has marriage become outdated in 2024? These Australians think so
